pullRequest.body:
Introduce two induction lemmas to ease proofs on category freely generated on a quiver.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

While experimenting, I found that in practice it’s a bit tedious to work with free categories on a quiver, as the instances get all confused when calling `cases` or `induction` on a morphism. This PR abstracts two induction principles that should ease this a little bit. The proof of `induction'` is admittedly a bit ugly.


[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [9a06fbd360](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18074/commits/9a06fbd3605522991a0570d873763a28d2b4a96e)

#### Import changes for modified files

<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.PathCategory`|-286|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.PathCategory.Basic`|286|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.PathCategory.MorphismProperty`|379|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ eq_nil_of_length_zero`
`+ eq_toPath_comp_of_length_eq_succ`
`+ induction`
`+ induction'`
`+ induction_fixed_source`
`+ induction_fixed_target`
`+ morphismProperty_eq_top`
`+ morphismProperty_eq_top'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

As it was useful in the case of localized categories (see `CategoryTheory.Localization.StructuredArrow`), could you prove first an induction principle for paths `a ⟶ b` for a fixed `a` (and if possible for a fixed `b`), and then deduce the induction general for all paths.
The two new lemmas for inductions with fixed source/targets are now added (with in fact almost the same code as the previous ones! I guess I was already proving them in a way).

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11479344967/job/31945437006)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11479344967/job/31945436513)

```suggestion
prove it for the identity and prove that the property is preserved under composition on the right
```

```suggestion
it for the identity and prove that the property is preserved under composition on the left
```
For this lemma and the next, it would be better to use `P : MorphismProperty (Paths V)`.

There is no need to introduce a name here:
```suggestion
variable (V : Type u₁) [Quiver.{v₁ + 1} V]
```

I would suggest adding the following lemma in `Combinatorics.Quiver.Path`:
```lean
lemma Path.eq_toPath_comp_of_length_eq_succ {a b : V} (p : Quiver.Path a b) {n : ℕ}
    (hp : p.length = n + 1) :
    ∃ (c : V) (f : a ⟶ c) (q : Quiver.Path c b) (_ : q.length = n),
      p = f.toPath.comp q := sorry
```
Then, the proof here can become:
```lean
lemma induction_fixed_target {b : Paths V} (P : ∀ {a : Paths V}, (a ⟶ b) → Prop)
    (id : P (𝟙 b))
    (comp : ∀ {u v : V} (p : of.obj v ⟶ b) (q : u ⟶ v), P p → P (of.map q ≫ p)) :
    ∀ {a : Paths V} (f : a ⟶ b), P f := by
  intro a f
  generalize h : f.length = k
  induction k generalizing f a with
  | zero => cases f with
    | nil => exact id
    | cons _ _ => simp at h
  | succ k h' =>
    obtain ⟨c, f, q, hq, rfl⟩ := f.eq_toPath_comp_of_length_eq_succ h
    exact comp _ _ (h' _ hq)
```

```suggestion
  | cons _ _ h => exact comp _ w h
```

```suggestion
    ∀ {a b : Paths V} (f : a ⟶ b), P f :=
  fun {_} ↦ induction_fixed_source _ id comp
```

```suggestion
  exact induction_fixed_target (P := fun f ↦ P f) id (fun _ _ ↦ comp _ _)
```

If you add the lemma
```lean
theorem eq_nil_of_length_zero (p : Path a a) (hzero : p.length = 0) : p = nil := by
  cases p
  · rfl
  · simp at hzero
```
then the proof can be slightly simplified:
```suggestion
lemma eq_toPath_comp_of_length_eq_succ (p : Path a b) {n : ℕ}
    (hp : p.length = n + 1) :
    ∃ (c : V) (f : a ⟶ c) (q : Quiver.Path c b) (_ : q.length = n),
      p = f.toPath.comp q := by
  induction p generalizing n with
  | nil => simp at hp
  | @cons c d p q h =>
    cases n
    · rw [length_cons, Nat.zero_add, Nat.add_left_eq_self] at hp
      obtain rfl := eq_of_length_zero p hp
      obtain rfl := eq_nil_of_length_zero p hp
      exact ⟨d, q, nil, rfl, rfl⟩
    · rw [length_cons, Nat.add_right_cancel_iff] at hp
      obtain ⟨x, q'', p'', hl, rfl⟩ := h hp
      exact ⟨x, q'', p''.cons q, by simpa, rfl⟩
```
I  did not know you could `obtain rfl`, that’s a nice trick!

As this increases the imports, could you do the following:
- rename `CategoryTheory.PathCategory` as `CategoryTheory.PathCategory.Basic`;
- add lemmas
```lean
lemma _root_.CategoryTheory.Paths.morphismProperty_eq_top
    (P : MorphismProperty (Paths V))
    (id : ∀ {v : V}, P (𝟙 (of.obj v)))
    (comp : ∀ {u v w : V} (p : of.obj u ⟶ of.obj v) (q : v ⟶ w), P p → P (p ≫ of.map q)) :
    P = ⊤ := sorry`
```
in a new file `CategoryTheory.PathCategory.MorphismProperty`
- in the file `PathCategory.Basic`, remove the import to `MorphismProperty.Basic` and revert to your original formulation of the induction principles (I am sorry I did not anticipate that).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/PathCategory): induction principles for morphisms in path categories
